, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>THE MAIN STREAM MEDIA NEVER SHOWS ALL THIS. &nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>WHEN DID YOU LAST SEE THE INDIAN MEDIA DOING SOME NATION BUILDING ARISING OUT OF DESH BHAKTI ? &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>INSTEAD THEY GIVE US TRUCKLOADS OF SACHIN TENDULKAR, AND KALKI KOECHLINS ..</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/9ClJxjilgjg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/9ClJxjilgjg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Burning Mountain, the\ncommon name for Mount Wingen, is a hill near Wingen, New South Wales,\nAustralia, approximately 224 km north of Sydney . This coal seam fire has been\nburning for 6000 years.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The underground fire is\nestimated to be at a depth of around 30 m .</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God has kept CO2 in the\natmosphere stable at 0.038% . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God has\nalso kept the salt in the ocean stable at 35 parts per thousand. (each liter of\nsea water contains about 35 grams of salt).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a example of the\nmagic of the trinity Brahma/ Vishnu/ Shiva in action. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our oceans act as a\nbuffer sink for CO2.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Molar Composition of\nSeawater<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Chemical&nbsp; &nbsp;/ &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Concentration (mol/kg)</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">H2O&nbsp;/ &nbsp;&nbsp;53.6<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cl-&nbsp; &nbsp; / &nbsp;&nbsp;0.546<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Na+&nbsp; / &nbsp;&nbsp;0.469<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mg2+&nbsp;/&nbsp;0.0528<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SO42-&nbsp; /0.0282<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ca2+&nbsp; /&nbsp;0.0103<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">K+&nbsp; &nbsp;/ &nbsp; &nbsp;0.0102<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/ph-chemical-tankers-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/ph-chemical-tankers-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Xeuyc55LqiY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Xeuyc55LqiY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/K5ZBtc1OSoI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/K5ZBtc1OSoI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oceans have a large\nabsorptive capacity for CO2 by virtue of its transformation into bicarbonate\nand carbonate in a slightly alkaline aqueous medium, and they contain about 60\ntimes as much inorganic carbon as is in the atmosphere. However, efficient\ntransfer takes place only into the topmost (100 m) wind-mixed layer. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans currents ensure proper mixing with\nbottom layers in a most efficient manner.&nbsp;\nMethane leaks underwater due to fractured shale rock seams ( methane\nexplosions due to using static electricity prone CO2 for fracking ) is\naffecting ocean currents and upwelling.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide is\nslightly soluble in pure water, the solubility decreases with temperature. Once\nit has dissolved, a small proportion of the CO2 reacts with water to form\ncarbonic acid-- or \u201cdissolved carbon dioxide\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concepts of\nalkalinity (acid-neutralizing capacity) and acidity (base neutralizing\ncapacity) are vital in characterizing the chemical state of natural waters,\nwhich always contain carbon dioxide and carbonates. CO2 acidity is the amount\nof OH\u2212 required to titrate a solution to a pH of 8.3. Alkalinity and acidity\nare conservative parameters, unaffected by temperature, pressure, and activity coefficients.&nbsp; This is not true for the pH, which will vary\nwith all of these factors. A water can simultaneously possess both alkalinity\nand acidity.&nbsp; Ocean waters contain\norganisms whose activities affect, and exert a major control over, the pH and\nalkalinity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Photosynthesis and\nrespiration by algae correspond to opposite directions of the reaction <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2O\nphotosynthesis \u2212)*\u2212 respiration (CH2O) + O2 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Addition or removal of\nCO2 have no direct effect on the alkalinity, but these processes do affect the\npH and are responsible for the significant diurnal changes in pH that can be\nobserved in ponds and small lakes.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plant growth requires the uptake of nitrogen\nand phosphorus which affect both the pH and the alkalinity The pH changes\nbrought about by assimilation or release of phosphate and nitrogen are usually\nquite small compared to those due to CO2 exchange.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although the salinity of\nseawater can vary locally (it is lower in estuaries and higher in regions of\nice formation and in semi-enclosed temperate oceans such as the mediterranean),\nthe relative amounts of the major ions remain remarkably constant<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although the the major\nionic components of seawater retain a nearly constant concentration ratio throughout\nthe oceans, this is not the case for some of the minor ones that are involved\nin biological processes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During daylight hours, phytoplankton photosynthesis\ncan considerably reduce total dissolved carbon ([TDC]) and remove phosphate\ncompletely from surface waters. Those phytoplankton and zooplankton that\nproduce calcite skeletal material remove CaCO3 (and thus alkalinity) from\nsurface waters and after dying transport it to the deep ocean where some of it\nredissolves.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That which remains in sediments gets incorporated into the slow\ngeological part of the carbon cycle from whence it is eventually replenished\npartly by input from rivers. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our PM Modi\nnow plans to kill our rivers with river interlinking. He thinks rivers are\ngutters draining into the sea. The latter carry not only dissolved bicarbonate,\nbut also suspended clay particles which release Ca2+ by exchange with Na+.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The overall alkalinity of the ocean has held\nfairly constant for at least the past 25 million years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atmospheric CO2 caused\nby the combustion of fossil fuel is taken up by the oceans. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A quantity known as the\nRevelle buffer factor is often used to express the way in which the partial pressure\nof CO2 in the atmosphere P depends on the total dissolved carbonate CT in the\nocean at constant alkalinity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Revelle factor\n(Buffer factor) is the ratio of instantaneous change in Carbon Dioxide (CO2) to\nthe change in total dissolved inorganic carbon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The buffer factor is\nused to examine the distribution of CO2 between the atmosphere and the ocean,\nand measures the amount of CO2 that can be dissolved in the mixed surface\nlayer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/ph-chemical-tankers-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/ph-chemical-tankers-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity is the\ndefined as a body of water\u2019s ability to react with the acidic proton. The\nalkalinity is like buffer capacity in that higher alkalinity is associated with\na body of water\u2019s ability to \"soak up\" proton without altering the\npH. Alkalinity is an important concept in understanding the effects of acid\nrain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity is different\nfrom basicity, which is directly related to the pH. The higher the pH, the more\nbasic the water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like acidity, there are\ndifferent ways to measure and report alkalinity;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first is to titrate\nthe water with acid titrant to the phenolphthalein end point. This is called\nthe phenolphthalein alkalinity. Since phenolphthalein changes color at pH~8.3 (\npH of oceans ) , this corresponds to a pH where all the CO32- present would be\nprotonated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Second, acid titration\nto a methyl orange end point, pH~4.3, further converts the bicarbonate to\naqueous carbon dioxide. At this end point, some of the weaker conjugate bases\nare protonated. The methyl orange end point titration indicates total alkalinity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity is typically\ndefined in terms of the equivalent weight, in milligrams (mg), of CaCO3 per\nliter of water. In other words, assuming that the alkalinity is due only to the\npresence of CaCO3. The mg of CaCO3 per liter is determined assuming all HCO3-\ncomes from CaCO3.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The alkalinity of a\nbody of water is important in the context of the acid rain problem. The more\nalkaline the water, the less susceptible it is to acidification.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dissolved carbon\ndioxide in the ocean occurs mainly in three inorganic forms:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">free aqueous carbon\ndioxide (CO2(aq)), bicarbonate (HCO3\u2212), and carbonate ion(CO32\u2212).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dissolved carbonate\nspecies in seawater provide an efficient chemical buffer to various processes\nthat change the properties of seawater.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For instance, the addition of a strong\nacid such as hydrochloric acid (naturally added to the ocean by&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">volcanism), is strongly\nbuffered by the seawater carbonate system. The seawater pH buffer is mainly a\nresult of the capacity of CO32\u2212 and HCO3 \u2212 ions to accept protons.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Revelle buffer factor,\nis important in the context of the oceanic uptake of anthropogenic CO2.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The accumulation and\ndissolution of reactive CaCO3 sediments in the deep sea provide a powerful\nfeedback to regulating the carbonate ion content ([CO32\u2212]) andthus the\nconcentration of dissolved CO2 in the ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Depending on the\ngeographic location, there is a certain depth above which the ocean floor is\nmainly covered with calcite while below it is largely calcite-free. The depth\nat which the sediments are virtually free of calcium carbonate is called the\ncalcium carbonate compensation depth (CCD).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The transition from calcite-rich to\ncalcite-depleted sediments is not abrupt but gradual and the depth of rapid\nincrease in the rate of dissolution as observed in sediments is called the\ncalcite lysocline. The reason for the disappearance of CaCO3 at depth is the\nincrease of solubility with pressure and thus with depth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2M1OlIPuqE4/VneAGb0boKI/AAAAAAABC24/2s9WfSgajHg/s1600/Figgg6-01.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"558\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2M1OlIPuqE4/VneAGb0boKI/AAAAAAABC24/2s9WfSgajHg/s640/Figgg6-01.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans actually absorb\nabout half of the increase in atmospheric CO2.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The equilibrium is\nmaintained by God ( Brahma. Vishnu/ Shiva ) in a way, modern scientists cannot\ndream of today.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3313964034914681691\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_57M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. ( KEPT AS SECRET )</b><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-obvv83azPHE/VnfhapSoNaI/AAAAAAABC5g/wK4Wb7Rfpiw/s1600/0.54132600_143738RR7697_20150738.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; With such large differences between high temperatures over\nNorth America and lower temperatures over the North Atlantic, the speed of the\njet stream between those places has increased dramatically. The result is that\nhuge amounts of warm air are being pushed high into the Arctic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Gulf stream's speed is accelerating due\nto these strong winds, and it is pushing ever warmer water underneath the sea\nsurface all the way into the Arctic Ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/03/st-patrick-genocide-of-druids-pope-leo.html?showComment=1458570329843#c2875425616085711766\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 21, 2016 at 7:55 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_237MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nWARNING<br />\nWARNING<br />\nWARNING<br />\n<br />\nMethane is warming this planet and all are going about \u201cbusiness as usual\u201d of blaming man made CO2.<br />\n<br />\nThere is now an alarming increase in the thawing of Earth\u2019s critical layer of permafrost.<br />\nAs the arctic soil freezes and thaws over many hundred years, it is cracked and buckled to create ice wedges, polygons, thermocarst lakes, and pingos.<br />\n<br />\nFreezing and melting processes are responsible for the ice wedge polygon structures in the Arctic lowlands typically found in permafrost. Even very brief periods of above-average warm temperatures can cause rapid changes to near-surface ice wedges in the permafrost. Arctic will lose many of its lakes and wetland areas if the permafrost retreats.<br />\n<br />\nThe permafrost contains huge amounts of frozen carbon from dead plant matter. When the temperature rises and the permafrost thaws, microorganisms become active and break down the previously trapped carbon. This in turn produces methane , which accelerates the greenhouse effect.<br />\n<br />\nThat layer of continuously frozen soil and rock covers millions of square miles in and around the arctic circle .<br />\n<br />\nPermafrost holds oceans of methane gas, which, when released, accelerate global warming.<br />\n<br />\nMassive releases of methane gas at the Arctic affects ocean currents and India\u2019s monsoons.<br />\n<br />\nFRACKING in developed western nations leaking Methane is being kept a secret. Methane caused more methane \u2013it is a vicious cycle.<br />\n<br />\nNatural gas is NOT not a \u201ccleaner\u201d alternative fuel compared to coal and petroleum.<br />\n<br />\nThe gas industry\u2019s adoption of fracking (short for hydraulic fracturing) has intensified water resource issues, because the practice involves pumping massive amounts of chemical brine underground.<br />\n<br />\nIn addition to the potential for improperly drilled wells to enable methane gas and other pollutants to travel from fracked wells into drinking water wells, disposal of wastewater from fracking operations has been linked to water contamination\u2014<br />\n-AND EARTH QUEAKS WHICH CAUSES CASCADE / DOMINO CRACKS AND METHANE LEAKS MOST OF WHICH HAPPEN UNDER THE SEA FLOOR.. The US GULF STREAM OCEAN CURRENT is now methane laden<br />\n<br />\nNatural gas has been promoted as a clean-energy source due to its relatively low emissions when burned. A glass of clean water is NOT necessarily good for your health over a glass of NOT so clean looking water.<br />\n<br />\nIT WILL TAKE ANOTHER 30 YEARS FOR THIS PLANET TO WAKE UP TO THE POSTS BELOW-<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/interstitial-lung-disease-nano-carbon.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/12/asd-atrial-septal-defect-hole-in-heart.html<br />\n<br />\nHowever, the natural gas lifecycle is peppered with opportunities to do a great amount of environmental damage, including water and air pollution from drilling sites, pipelines and vehicular transportation, as well as storage facilities.<br />\n<br />\nUSA is 19.3 TRILLION USD in external debt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/steroid-pumped-muscles-do-not-provide.html?showComment=1513752175650#c2461307375127586492\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">December 20, 2017 at 12:12 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_56MC\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/12/thermal-coal-power-plants-clean-exhaust_9.html</span><br /><br />I HAVE WRITTEN ABOUT COAL GASIFICATION TWO YEARS AGO ( IN MY 6 PARTS SERIES ABOVE ) FOR SYNGAS PRODUCTION AND FURTHER METHANOL SYNTHESIS<br /><br />THEY HAVE LIFTED FROM MY POSTS.<br /><br />Coal gasification, followed by the water shift reaction, can be used to produce syngas which is then converted downstream to methanol.<br /><br />ROTHSCHILD STARTED PRODUCING COAL FROM RANIGANJ COALFIELD USING HIS OPIUM DRUG RUNNING AGENT AND SONAGACHI WHORE HOUSE OWNER DWARAKNATH TAGORE (GRANDFATHER OF RABINDRANATH TAGORE ) .<br /><br />DWARAKNATH TAGORE USED TRIBALS SANTALS AND BAURIS AS SLAVES IN COALMINES<br /><br />RANIGANJ COAL IS SUITABLE FOR COAL GASIFICATION<br /><br />Methane aDdsorbed into the solid matrix of the coal is called 'sweet gas' because of its lack of hydrogen sulfide. Methane is stored within the coal by a process called aDsorption.<br /><br />The methane is in a near-liquid state, lining the inside of pores within the coal (called the matrix). The open fractures in the coal (called the cleats) can also contain free gas or can be saturated with water.<br /><br />UCG ( UNDERGROUND COAL GASIFICATION without fracking ) delivers 20 times more energy from the same coal resource than what\u2019s possible from CSG (COAL SEAM GAS )<br /><br />Air or a combination of oxygen and steam are injected into the&nbsp;gasification panel within the coal seam. The coal is then heated and controlled reactions convert solid coal into product gas, known as SYNGAS, which is extracted at the surface<br /><br />Underground coal gasification (UCG) is extraction of energy from coal and lignite resources that are otherwise deemed uneconomical through conventional mining methods.<br /><br />UCG technology protects natural groundwater reserves. Groundwater quality is preserved by operating the gasification process below the hydrostatic pressure<br /><br />Maintaining the surrounding groundwater pressure acts as containment for the gasification process and ensures that the product gas, \u201csyngas\u201d, flows to the surface under pressure via the Production Well.<br /><br />The mixture of carbon monoxide and hydrogen is called synthesis gas or SYNGAS.<br /><br />IDIOTS IN THE COAL MINISTRY DO NOT KNOW ALL THIS<br /><br />In the Surat Basin, the CSG process extracts HUMONGOUS QUANTITIES OF GROUND WATER for every PJ of gas.<br /><br />CSG recovers gas out of the coal seam without utilising the energy in the coal itself.<br /><br />Following CSG production the energy contained within the coal itself cannot be harnessed using UCG technology until natural groundwater pressure is restored.<br /><br />The Fischer-Tropsch (FT) process, is a series of chemical reactions that involve the conversion of hydrogen and carbon monoxide into liquid hydrocarbons by using a catalyst. Nickel is used as the catalyst, as it tends to promote methane formation.<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=44OU4JxEK4k<br /><br />https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0mn8xpSqUho</span><br /><br />Mathanol is periodically used as a replacement for gasoline, particularly for racing fuel, as it has a high octane number. It has no sulfur in it, will produce almost no NOX due to the low flame temperature, and can be blended with gasoline.<br /><br />ON CHEMICAL TANKERS WE ARE EXPERTS IN METHANOL<br /><br />THE POSTS BELOW SHOWS THAT SEA IS A PLACE FOR CUNTS<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/methanol-spray-on-chemical-tankers-capt.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/airline-breathing-apparatus-on-chemical.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/my-experience-at-mundra-port-adani-sez.html</span><br /><br />capt ajit vadakayil<br />..</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Grace and peace !</span></b><br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/AfdHBJIghik/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/AfdHBJIghik?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PW0yxDqiJ1c/VnQQ1FL4kFI/AAAAAAABCyg/0FLee9v0ywc/s1600/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadakayil1%2B2.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PW0yxDqiJ1c/VnQQ1FL4kFI/AAAAAAABCyg/0FLee9v0ywc/s1600/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadakayil1%2B2.JPG\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n..</div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Trade\nfacilitation agreement (TFA) is a trade protocol aiming to do away with checks\nand balance\u2014according to the rich countries , the stumbling blocks in doing\ninternational trade .. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>India\nat present is running a massive food procurement programmes by providing\nminimum supporting price to the farmers and giving subsidised food to lakhs of\nBPL families through its public distribution system (PDS). <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>The\nnew WTO agreement limits the value of food subsidies at 10 percent of the total\nfood grain production.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>India\nqueries that when US is providing 120 billion as agriculture subsidy then why\nIndia can't give even one tenth (USD 12 billion) to their own farmers, who are\ncommitting suicide .<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>India\nhas 350 million hungry and poor people. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>We do\nwe have a govt ? <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>The\ngovt has feed its people, right?\u2014 without falling prey to wolves like GM food\ncorpns like Monsanto/ Cargill ? <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Our\nfood programme is almost fully domestic so it doesn't distort global food trade\nat all . <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Once\nthe TFA will be implemented it will be difficult to bargain on the food subsidy\nthing. The problem with TFA runs in a clause that says farm subsidies cannot be\nmore than 10 percent of the value of agricultural production.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>If the cap is\nbreached, other members can challenge it and also go on to impose trade\nsanctions on the country.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">There exists Anaerobic bacteria in oceans who\ngulp methane and release CO2 in its place . &nbsp;&nbsp;This is being FALSELY labeled as man made CO2.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">GAAND\nMAARA TULSI NEH PAKDE GAYE KABIR ?!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methane (CH4) in the\nocean is to a large extend consumed by microorganisms.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During anaerobic decay\nwithin the sea floor, microbes convert methane with the help of sulphate (SO4 ^2-).\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This process produces\nhydrogen sulphide anions (HS\u2013) and hydrogen sulphide (H2S), which are closely\nrelated chemically and occur naturally together, as well as bicarbonate\n(CaCO3). Bicarbonate can react with calcium ions (Ca2+) to precipitate as\ncalcium carbonate (CaCO3). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During aerobic decay\n(in the water column) oxygen (O2) from the water is consumed. Carbon dioxide\n(CO2) and water (H2O) are produced. When huge amounts of methane are released, &nbsp;aerobic decay could result in the creation of\noxygen depleted zones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CH4 + 2 O2 = &nbsp;CO2 + 2 H2O<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fracking speeds up\nhuman-caused climate change, thanks to potent greenhouse gas methane leaks\nalone. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\">Natural gas is mostly methane,\n(CH4), a super-potent greenhouse gas, which traps <span style=\"color: blue;\">86 times </span>as much heat as CO2\nover a 20-year period.</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 100-year GWP (\nglobal waming potential ) of methane is 45 percent higher than currenly being\nestimated by the OIL/ GAS and FRACKING lobby<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
