, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">############################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>hi cot,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>indian thermal coal has very low SULPHUR\ncontent, which is good.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>India produces more than 36 million tons of\nfly ash which can be stored in abandoned coal mines.&nbsp;&nbsp; Concrete and concrete ingredients use fly\nash markets. It is NOT a waste .<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>In India there is TOTAL lack of knowledge\nabout fly ash, its properties<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>and potential applications. India can seek\nhelp from Germany.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Coal ash is a beneficial raw material not an\ninferior waste product. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash can be used for the refilling and\nreclamation of depleted opencast lignite mines. They can be&nbsp; used in underground mining, for surface\nrecultivation, soil beneficiation, cement production and as addition to\nconcrete.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">ashes rich in lime are effective for\nstabilizing soils, due to the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">amount of free calcium oxide. Those with low\nlime content&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">can be used in combination with cement or\nlime for the same&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">purpose.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash can be used as filler in asphalt.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly ash has &nbsp;two classes: Class F and Class\nC. &nbsp; The&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Class F fly ashes are normally generated due\nto combustion of anthracite or bituminous coal.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The Class C fly ashes are produced due to\nburning of lignite or subbutiminous coal. Most fly ashes are rich in SiO2,\nAl2O3, and Fe2O3, and contain significant amounts of CaO, MgO, MnO, TiO2, Na2O,\nK2O, SO3, etc. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Class C fly ashes (high-lime fly ashes) typically\ncontain CaO in excess of<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">10% up to 40%, and Class F fly ashes\n(low-lime fly ashes) generally contain less than 10% CaO.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Due to high CaO content, Class C fly ashes\nparticipate in both cementitious and pozzolanic&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">reactions whereas Class F fly ashes predominately\nparticipate in pozzolanic reaction during the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">hydration process.&nbsp;</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Therefore, Class C fly\nashes are classified as cementitious and pozzolanic admixtures/additives and\nClass F fly ashes as normal pozzolans for use in concrete.</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The inclusion of fly ash in construction\nfills and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">embankments not only provides economical\nalternatives to natural soils and rocks due to its&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">availability in urban areas but also it\nimproves their properties such as shear strength, pozzolanic</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>properties, ease of handling, moisture\ninsensitivity, etc<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash has favorable properties of this\nmaterial, such as light weight, high shear strength, self-hardening properties,\netc. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nbehavior of the fly ash&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">and the stabilizer mixture is similar to that\nof a fine-grained soil cement mixture, but pozzolanic&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">reaction of the fly ash results in an\nincrease in strength and impermeability with time. This&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">enhances the durability of the base or\nsubbase course.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly ash alone or in combination with lime, is\nused to&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">stabilize the subgrade in order to reduce\nplasticity, enhance strength, and improve workability of</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>weak soils.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash is an excellent cover material for\nlandfills due to its several favorable<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">properties such as compactability, shrinkage,\nand cementing behavior. It can be used in place of&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">silts or clays for daily, intermediate, and\nfinal covers.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Addition of fly ash to soil results in\nimprovements of infiltration<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>characteristics, moisture-holding\ncapabilities, and plant nutrients (trace elements).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash can be used to neutralize the acidity\nof soil by increasing its pH value<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The reclamation of&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">soil to be used for agriculture, turf-grass,\nparkland, etc., has been accomplished by adding fly ash to&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">it.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The flowable ash slurry is a low strength\nmaterial whose strength can vary<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">between 50 to 1200 psi (0.34 - 8.22 MPa).\nThis type of material contains large amounts of fly ash&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">(20 to 90% of the total mix), low amounts of\ncement, and requires high water-to-cementitious&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">material ratio to produce a high degree of\nfluidity.&nbsp;</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The resulting material is suitable for&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">foundations, bridge abutments, buildings,\nretaining walls, utility trenches, as backfills, etc.; for&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">abandoned tunnels, sewers, and other\nunderground facilities as fills; and as embankments, grouts,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">etc</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly ash can be utilized in water pollution\ncontrol. This includes&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">neutralization of acidic wastewaters,\nphosphorus removal from wastewater, physical conditioner for&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">sludge dewatering, sorbent for various\norganics, sealing of contaminated sediments, etc</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly ash is used as either a&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">raw material in the production of the cement\nclinker, interground with the clinker or blended with&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">the finished cement . Fly ash can be\nsubstituted for up to 8% of the clinker in manufacture of&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">cement . Gypsum obtained from FGD process may\nbe added to the clinker as a set&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">retarding agent.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Concrete pipe made with fly ash is superior\nto no-fly ash concrete pipe . Fly ash pipes are more watertight and more\nresistant to weak&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">acids and sulfates attack relative to plain\nportland cement concrete pipes.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">RCC is very low in water-to-cementitious\nratio (zero slump)&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">and contains higher proportions of fine\nparticles to reduce segregation. The lower water-to-cement</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ratio results in higher strength compared to\nthe conventional mix. Fly ash can be used in large&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">amounts as a fine filler material as well as\na pozzolan in the RCC mix</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Autoclaved cellular concrete (ACC) or aerated\nconcrete is a&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">lightweight material. It is manufactured\nusing powder silica sand, portland cement, limestone,</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">aluminum powder, and water as raw materials. &nbsp;In the case of fly ash ACC, fly ash replaces 30 to&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">100% of the sand. In order to manufacture\nACC, the ingredients are mixed into a slurry and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">poured into greased molds up to two-thirds of\ntheir depth.&nbsp;</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The reactions that occur between the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">aluminum powder, calcium hydroxide, and water\ngenerate hydrogen gas which aerates the mixture&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">producing millions of non-connected\nmicroscopic cells.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash is used in the production of\nautoclaved concrete blocks. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Compared to plain portland cement ACC, the\nfly ash ACC offers&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">several advantages such as lower weight,\nhigher insulation capability (R-value of 10 to 12 for six</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">inch thick material), a fire rating of at\nleast two hours, more easily worked with carpenter's tools,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">etc.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly ash can be utilized in manufacture of the\nfired, unfired, and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">steam cured bricks</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A mixture of large quantities of fly ash, low&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">amounts of cement, and sand, can be\nproportioned to produce good quality bricks. Blocks and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">paving stones can also be manufactured by\nadding appropriate amount of coarse aggregate to the</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>mixture .<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash as a binder can be used to\nmanufacture mortar for brick walls, grouts, etc<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly ash can be used in high-flexural strength&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">ceramics. These include railroad ties,\nelectric line insulators, fence posts, etc. Currently these&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">products are being made with concrete or\nclay-based materials.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Fly ash can be used as a mineral filler in\nthe asphaltic concrete mixtures.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The use of fly ash as an asphalt additive is\neconomically attractive, and its performance in the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">asphaltic mixture compares favorably with\nother fillers.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the west artificial&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">reefs with blocks composed of fly ash, bottom\nash, FGD sludge, lime, and cement.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Coal ash is utilized effectively in\nstabilization/solidification&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">technologies for both industrial and\nmunicipal wastes.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>These wastes can be inorganic, organic, or\ncombined/complex. The wastes can be<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">further classified as hazardous or\nnon-hazardous wastes. Addition of fly ash to wastes can improve&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">their handling characteristics due to\nincreased fluidity. Fly ash is used as a binding agent alone or&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">in conjunction with other binders such as\nlime, portland cement, etc. for stabilization of the wastes.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The reactions of fly ash in the mix, both\ncementitious and pozzolanic, results in formation of C-S-H&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">matrix in which wastes are entrapped or\nmicroencapsulated . The mixture of waste&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">containing fly ash with or without other\nbinders is proportioned to meet environmental criteria&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">especially leaching characteristics, and\nstrength and durability requirements.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Several metals have been extracted from fly\nash. In general, two methods are<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">used to recover metals from fly ash: the\ndirect acid leaching (DAL) and pressure digestion- acid&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">leach (PDA) for extraction of metals. The\nmajor metals extracted from fly ash are alumina and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">iron, and the other trace elements include\nchromium, cobalt, manganese, etc. The resource&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">components of fly ash for which favorable\ncost-effective process exists are carbon, magnetite,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">cenospheres, and metals such as alumina, iron\noxide, etc</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Cenospheres derived from fly ash are an ideal&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">filler material for manufacture of polymer\nmatrix composites .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The polymeric matrix can&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">be composed of either thermoplastic or\nthermosetting plastics.&nbsp;</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Due to spherical shape of these&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">particles, they offer several advantages over\nthe fillers having irregular shapes .</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These include: ease of wetting and\ndispersion, uniform stress distribution during molding, reduced&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">shrinkage during cooling, reduced warpage of\ninjection molding components, reduced wear of&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">fabrication equipment, etc. The use of such\nfillers not only reduces the demand for costly plastic&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">matrix materials but also improves several\nproperties of the matrix.&nbsp;</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The polymer matrix materials&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">that have been used in such PMC include epoxy\nresins, polypropylene, nylon, PVC, polyethylene,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">etc. The improvement in properties of the\ncomposites due to inclusion of the cenosphere are</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>compressive strength, elastic modulus,\nreduction in thermal expansion, and thermal conductivity.<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">However, mostly tensile strength and fracture\nproperties deteriorate due to inclusion of large&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">amounts of the filler. Therefore, optimum\nlevel of the filler concentration should be determined&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">for a particular application.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fly ash has been used as a component of the\nmetal matrix of a&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">suitable composite prepared by foundry\nprocesses .The second phase particles can improve physical,</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">mechanical, and tribological properties of\nthe matrix material. In general, inclusion of fly ash&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">particles in aluminum alloy matrix has shown\na decrease in its density, and increases in its elastic&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">modulus, abrasion resistance, and hardness .&nbsp;</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Besides, the replacement of&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">aluminum with fly ash would provide large\nsavings in cost of the materials. Such&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">a low-cost composite can be made suitable for\na number of automotives and electromechanical&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">applications such as pistons, cylinder\nliners, bearings, and current collectors.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Filler applications include asphalt&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">roofing shingles, wallboards, joint\ncompounds, carpet backing, vinyl flooring, industrial coatings,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">etc.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The fly ash cenospheres have also been found\nappropriate for numerous<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">applications such as: (1) tape for\nfireproofing and insulating high voltage cables; (2) closed pore&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">insulating material being used as heat\nshields in aerospace industries; (3) liquid epoxy molding&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">systems for electronic castings; (4) foundry\nsand to reduce weight and improve flow of sand used in&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">molding; (5) molded ornament panels used in\nfurniture; (6) fabrics for protecting personnel from</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">molten metals; (7) replacement for glass\nbeads in synthetic foam used to achieve buoyancy in&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">23&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">oceanographic applications; and, (8) medium\nfor growing turf grass.</span></span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Mineral wool is primarily a glassy, fibrous\ninsulating material. It is generally<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">manufactured from mixtures of metal\nprocessing slags and limestone or silica Mineral wool&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">can be manufactured using either bottom ash\nor fly ash. These ashes can be processed to produce&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">fine insulating fibers, similar to that of\ncommercial mineral wool.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Capt ajit vadakayil<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">..</span></i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/oUkLOLjLu0Q/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/oUkLOLjLu0Q?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/_iwHwUUdxiY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/_iwHwUUdxiY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/mludVHlNTCo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/mludVHlNTCo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;###################################</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below : &nbsp;Ammonium Sulphate is a soil\nfertilizer. It contains 21% nitrogen and 24% sulfur. Because AS contains 100%\nammonium nitrogen it guarantees a long-term and sustainable nitrogen supply.\nFurthermore it prevents the nitrogen from being washed out of the soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/5EAx71_94d8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/5EAx71_94d8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/foam-froth-on-bangalore-lakes-capt-ajit.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/foam-froth-on-bangalore-lakes-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">AMMONIUM NITRATE ( UREA ) CAN BE USED IN EXPLOSIVES&nbsp;</b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/TlWlrb4zqbM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/TlWlrb4zqbM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/pxiRC44tN70/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/pxiRC44tN70?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/AJBwj9bs_Ag/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/AJBwj9bs_Ag?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrostatic smoke precipitators\nwork by forcing dirty flue gas (the gas escaping from a smokestack) past two\nelectrodes (electrical terminals), which take the form of metal wires, bars, or\nplates inside a pipe or smokestack.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first electrode is charged to a very\nhigh negative voltage. As the dirt particles move past it, they pick up a\nnegative charge. Higher up the pipe (or further along, if it's a horizontal\npipe), there's a second electrode consisting of metal plates charged to a high\npositive voltage. Since unlike charges attract, the negatively charged soot\nparticles are attracted to the positively charged plates and stick there.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From\ntime to time, the collecting plates have to be shaken to empty away the soot;\nthat can be done either manually (by someone brushing them clean) or\nautomatically (by some kind of automated shaking or brushing mechanism in a\nprocess called rapping).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrostatic smoke\nprecipitators use static electricity to remove the soot from smoke. Dirty air\nmoves past negatively charged wires (shown as \u2212ve) so the soot particles pick\nup a negative charge. The negatively charged particles of soot then stick to\npositively charged plates (shown as +ve) further along the pipe. Much cleaner\nair emerges from the pipe as a result.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some power plants try\nto minimize sulfur dioxide pollution (which causes acid rain) by burning\nlow-sulfur coal that typically produces more ash. Since the coal is less\ncalorific (energy-containing), you need to burn more of it to make the same\namount of energy, which means more ash again. Low-sulfur coal produces a\ndifferent kind of ash that has a higher electrical resistivity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This makes ESP\nequipment less effective so, to achieve the same reduction in pollution, it\ngenerally has to be scaled-up in size to compensate. The effectiveness of ESP\nis also affected by the temperature and moisture content of the flue gas\n(low-sulfur coal burns at a lower-temperature and often contains more\nmoisture). ESP isn't 100 percent effective and some pollution will always\nremain behind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JUST SAW SOME MORONS DEBATE ON TV , &nbsp;WITH OUR DEMENTED COCAINE SNORTING ORANGUTAN JUMPING UP AND DOWN<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The new Euro 6 regulations\nset different standards for petrol and diesel cars. &nbsp;For diesel cars, they dramatically drop the\npermitted level of NOx emitted down to a maximum of 80mg/km compared to the\n180mg/km level that was required for cars to meet the previous Euro 5 emissions\nstandards. The limit for NOx from petrol cars remains at 60mg/km, the same as\nfor the Euro 5 standard.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diesel cars tend to be\nbetter than petrol models when it comes to CO2 output. &nbsp;BUT IN INDIA WE LOVE CO2\nEMISSIONS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">European emission\nstandards first came in to force in 1992 with Euro 1 standards becoming law.\nThis initial standard ensured that diesel cars emitted no more than 780mg/km of\nNOx, while the maximum for petrol engines was 490mg/km. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This moved on to Euro 2\nin 1997 that dropped diesel NOx to 730mg/km and Euro 3 standards followed in\n2000 lowering the diesel NOx limit to 500mg/km. By 2006, Euro 4 emissions were\nin place reducing the max NOx in diesels to 250mg/km and Euro 5 reduced it\nfurther to 180mg/km in 2009.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Throughtout this time,\nthe maximum amount of NOx emitted by diesel cars has been way behind that of\npetrol models. Under the new Euro 6 standards, however, the maximum level for\nNOx in diesel models is 80mg/km compared to 60mg/km in petrol cars.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-AjArS94h1K4/VnGaq3gsWLI/AAAAAAABCw0/0FV07s-nTf8/s1600/050712vRRDt_Emission_standards_0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"352\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-AjArS94h1K4/VnGaq3gsWLI/AAAAAAABCw0/0FV07s-nTf8/s640/050712vRRDt_Emission_standards_0.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-F2s6lNsa2wk/VnGeY3_02dI/AAAAAAABCxw/jOEz5iB7aKk/s1600/WWWgasoline-sulfur-limits2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"492\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-F2s6lNsa2wk/VnGeY3_02dI/AAAAAAABCxw/jOEz5iB7aKk/s640/WWWgasoline-sulfur-limits2.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: white; line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 6.0pt; mso-outline-level: 2; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n<span style=\"color: #111111; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Euro emissions standards for diesel cars&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"MsoNormalTable\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse; Reforming unfair agricultural practices were at the centre of the Doha agenda.<br />\n<br />\nOn the eve of the Nairobi ministerial, that agenda itself is under threat. The US, EU, and Japan have proposed jettisoning the Doha agenda and the progress made before negotiations broke down in 2008.<br />\n<br />\nWhy is Modi sucking up to Rothschild\u2019s agent Japan ? Japan knows that their economy can be saved only by India.<br />\n<br />\nWe do NOT want India to be a dumping ground.<br />\n<br />\nThe WTO commits nations not to export at prices below domestic prices or below prices in other export markets. Beyond this kind of discriminatory pricing, though, the WTO agreements also define dumping as exporting at below the costs of production.<br />\n<br />\nUnfair competition cost developing countries dearly, undermining local farm economies in favour of cheap imports.<br />\n<br />\nWhy is India importing food ?<br />\n<br />\nWhy is India importing thermal coal ?<br />\n<br />\nMost of the super \u2013rich Indians are just BENAMI fronts for Jew Rothschild who ruled India.<br />\n<br />\nTheir loyalties are to the Jew and NOT to Bharatmata.<br />\n<br />\nUS is already exporting corn at below the costs of production. Farmgate prices this year have been $19/ton below production costs, with US exports priced at $165/ton.<br />\n<br />\nWith Farm Bill support prices at $179/ton, US corn farmers stand to receive some $6 billion in government payments this year.<br />\n<br />\nI ate a US GM corn BHUTTA three days ago, and my stomach is still queasy.<br />\n<br />\nMODI MUST REMEMBER , THAT AS LONG AS WE PRODUCE OUR OWN FOOD AND SAVE ENOUGH FOOD FOR THREE CONSECUTIVE MONSOON FAILURES-THE WEST CANNOT BLEED BHARATMATAs FEET AS SHE MARCHED TO TAKE HER RIGHTFUL SPOT AS NO 1 SUPER POWER ON THIS PLANET\u2014 THE ONLY ONE.<br />\n<br />\nMR NARENDA MODI, CAN YOU EXPLAIN TO INDIANS , WHY US PRESIDENT OBAMA CONGRATULATED AND THANKED YOU AFTER PARIS COP 21.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS BLOGSITE KNOWS !<br />\n<br />\nWHAT A DISGRACE !!<br />\n<br />\nThe WTO was established to organise and facilitate free trade to ensure economic development across countries of the world.<br />\n<br />\nHowever, it is just an EVIL forum for rich nations to exploit the poor..<br />\n<br />\nWHOM ARE YOU WORKING FOR MR MODI, ROTHSCHILD OR BHARATMATA ?<br />\n<br />\nAPCO MODI , THIS BLOGSITE WILL WATCH EVERY INCH OF YOUR ZIONIST SPONSORED PROGRESS AT WTO NAIROBI. . .<br />\n<br />\nDO NOT ABDICATE.<br />\n<br />\nTHE ZIONIST JEWS HAVE BEEN HYPOCRITICAL FOR TOO LONG.<br />\n<br />\nNOT ANY MORE !<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under the Clean Air\nAct, the U.S. EPA establishes national ambient air quality standards for six\ncommon air pollutants including carbon monoxide (CO), ground level ozone (O3),\nlead, nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur dioxide (SO2), and particulate matter (PM,\nPM10 and PM2.5). In parallel with this effort, the EPA, states, and local air\npollution agencies have developed and set increasingly stringent emission standards\nto reduce the emissions of primary air pollutants NOx, SOx, PM, PM10, PM2.5, as\nwell as VOCs and other types of acid gases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FOR YEARS THE ZIONIST\nJEWS FOOLED THE WORLD WITH \u201cGREEN \u201c BIOFUELS USING GM CORN, SUGARCANE ,\nJATROPHA ETC. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IT WAS ALL ABOUT THE MONSANTO TYPES &nbsp;GETTING A TOE HOLD IN DEVELOPING NATIONS .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nprimary uses of water for biodiesel refining are to wash plants and seeds for\nprocessing&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
